headline: German Chocolate Cake Frosting
description: This German chocolate frosting is made with coconut and pecans for a thick, creamy, and delicious homemade topping perfect on German chocolate cake.

video.description: Here's the secret to making your own delicious German chocolate cake frosting.
video.name: German Chocolate Cake Frosting

name: German Chocolate Cake Frosting

recipeInstructions.text: Combine evaporated milk, brown sugar, butter, egg yolks, and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, at a low boil until mixture turns a light caramel color and thickens, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in coconut and pecans. Let cool to room temperature before spreading on cake.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make and the taste is exquisite.

This recipe is exceptional! I made this exactly as the recipe stated. I stirred it on stove until thickened and stirring left small indents from my whisk passing through, then off stove and added pecans and coconut. Next time I am going to toast nuts and coconut as some other bakers suggested as I do believe that will enhance it and make it a 5 star.
I made it and it turned out fabulous!! Tastes so much better then the store bought frosting! Spreads nicely and tastes GREAT! Highly recommended!
delicious
What a delicious German chocolate frosting. I added two teaspoons of vanilla bean paste and it made it so creamy and yummy.
This frosting is amazing! Just like my mom used to make for me. She doubled the recipe and I will too so that there is plenty of frosting for a double layer cake inside and out❤️
Excellent recipe!!
great frosting
The taste is good...but it never did really get thick..yes I followed the recipe to the letter...will look for another recipe

This is the recipe handed down from my mother years ago. I think it's in an old Better Homes and Garden book too. I always put a pinch of salt in the recipe. It cuts the sweetness and lets the flavors shine more. My stove runs hotter so I need to it low and stirring not constantly but not leaving the frosting cook on it's own either. For me it takes 20 minutes to cook.

I had never made this kind of frosting before; I had made a box chocolate cake and found this frosting recipe. As I was stirring, I thought the mixture would thicken when cooled. Not so - it thickens while hot. Have faith and keep stirring while it's bubbling - a wire whisk worked great. Don't step away from the stove. This frosting tasted great, just like downtown!

Have made it twice now, and it makes a standard box mix german choc cake into something that my family raves about.
The cooking time, esp done at med-low, is a bit of a pain as it seems to take 20-25 mins of steady stirring to thicken, but the end result is well worth it.

I made 1 change , as my wife loves coconut I added 2 cups not 1 1/3. I made her a german chocolate cake for her birthday tomorrow and the frosting is incredibly delicious. I will use this frequently. As an add on, my wife and I live in Bolivia, South America and we are both retired and baking is my hobby.

Far to sweet will use less sugar next time, otherwise perfect. No you don't need to use cornstarch just large egg yolks or add an extra egg yolk. Just be patient and wait for mixture to thicken cos it will ok

When I say this icing is everything!! Is an understatement…. I used boxed cake mix but I didn’t want the store bought icing. You can taste every ingredient in this icing something about the butter and brown sugar that’s just so yummy. I didn’t have an issues with the icing thickening you just have to take your time and constantly stir while it’s cooking I call being patient while cooking “cooking with love”. I followed the exact recipe and I will be making again.
It's easy to make and it was delicious.
Excellent - love it!
Great frosting and so easy.
I made it just the way it was. I will be using more often
Excellent
Love this recipe. I'm not a fan of coconut shavings, so this aloud me to add coconut flavor instead. I got to have my cake and eat it too.

Wow, this was absolutely fantastic! I made it for German Chocolate Cupcakes for my mom's birthday. My only suggestion is to wait until you pull it off the stove to add the vanilla. Otherwise, it is perfect as is. I did follow other reviewers suggestions to cook over Low for 10-12 minutes. Then it thickens as it cools. We have some non-coconutters in the fam so I left out the coconut. I toasted the pecans, too. Thank you for a wonderful recipe!
Best ever!
This turned out perfectly and was delicious! I used it to fill a chocolate cake with a dark chocolate ganache frosting. I would definitely make this again.
This is absolutely the best German Chocolate Cake frosting I've ever made. It's so simple to make and so delicious to eat! I would not change a thing about it.
Great recipe, my husband promised he would save room for supper if I gave him a sample, he loved it!??
The fam loves. For me, it’s always really runny and thin. Thickens up nicely in the freezer!

This frosting has all the decadent flavor you’d expect but mine ended up too dense and hard to spread. I probably cooked it too long. It definitely needs a cooking time added. (I cooked mine on medium for at least 20 minutes.)

Loved it! I usually don't eat german chocolate cake, but I love this. I adjusted the recipe for 16 servings and it was perfect. Instead of heating all the ingredients together, I melted the butter and then added the remaining wet ingredients. I also used rum instead of vanilla. Like some of the other readers I decided to lightly toast the coconut and pecans. My family loved it.

I actually didn't eat this myself (I'm dairy-free), but I made it for my mom's birthday cake. She raved, and raved, and raved; gave it a 12/10. The cake was devoured within two days, and she only shared two or three slices.
I'll echo what others have said: it takes much longer than stated to thicken on the heat, but the end result is fantastic regardless. The only alteration I made was toasting the pecans and coconut. This is the only German chocolate cake frosting I'll be using from now on.
It was super easy to make and really yummy! My husband and kids LOVED it!
It was awesome. I did think it might be more helpful to have an approximate cooking time instead of saying "cook until thick".
This is a super good recipe! Definitely try it. I did add 1/2 cup more of pecans and also coconut. I liked mine more chunky. The taste is soo invigorating! Thank you for this recipe!
My husband thought it tasted great.

German chocolate cake is a favorite in our house for birthdays and other occasions. This frosting recipe makes a box cake taste homemade! We love this. I will never use any other recipe and it is so delicious it's incredible! Thank you!
My egg yolks cooked in the hot mixture! So, I removed them but the flavor was still delicious!
Super easy to make, my cake was a smash hit!
YUM! Never made it with brown sugar before, adds a little extra flavor. I needed a bit more coconut, but it does depend on how you pack it right
Easy peasy, super delicious! Will make it again

It was horrible!! Came out SUPER runny, and this was after everything cooled down, and I put it on the cake. HUGE mistake. Waste of eggs. All of the icing ran off the cake and all that was left was wet coconuts and pecans on a cake.

Great ricipe!
The trick is to make sure you thicken it enough! Keep it on the heat stirring constantly for 10 mins atleast. I am a professional baker so I have an eye for changes in recipes so I added an additional egg yolk to make sure this would be thick enough to hold in the sides of a cake. 
I cooled the frosting in the freezer stiring every 10 mins until cool then filled and iced the entire 6 inch cake...So far so good, its holding on the sides of the cake but I imagine you want to keep this in the fridge! 

This is sinfully DELICIOUS!!!

It’s just barely enough to frost a double layer cake but I made it work and it was delicious. Make sure to cook it for long enough to cook egg yolks, the lack of time in the recipe make me a little nervous but i appreciates someone’s review with the recommendation to cook for 12 minutes, which I did.
I will never by store bought frosting again.
Perfect! It wasn’t overly sweet with the chocolate cake we used! Everyone loved it!
perfect
This recipe was easy & delicious. I put on cake & then under the broiler for a minute or two to toast the coconut like my grandma use to do.

I made chocolate cupcakes with raspberry filling ,then topped them with this frosting !! 
 Took them to work to get a reaction, the fellow drivers went wild !! This frosting is absolutely the best!! I think the brown sugar is the way to go for color and taste !! Great recipe !!

Absolutely amazing frosting. 
I cooked a little too long. But added a little more milk to thin it.
I will never buy prepared coconut/ pecan frosting again!
Made it for a German chocolate cake mix. It was absolutely delicious! Not too sweet.
First time making this icing. I doubled the recipe to fill 3 layers and cover the entire cake. I had to cook a little longer because it was doubled. It turned out perfect and delicious.
The recipe as is needs work. With all the modifications suggested by others it was ok. I’ll keep looking for the perfect German chocolate cake frosting recipe

So simple and delicious! It takes buttery and caramelly. I lost my old recipe to German Chocolate Cake Frosting and I'm glad I did because I got to try this one. My husband is German and he went crazy over this frosting! Thank you!

This recipe is definitely a keeper....except the directions should be to cook the frosting on MEDIUM heat for about 10 minutes instead of low heat. Stir constantly and mixture will thicken. Add coconut and pecans, stir together and let cool to room temp. Perfect!
Awesome!!!i
Great!
Delicious! Easy to make!
It’s all I can do to not scrape off the frosting and eat it for breakfast this morning! Delicious!
This is a wonderful recipe for delicious frosting! It takes a bit of time to get it thickened up, but really tastes great.
Turned out great, easy to make. I will use again.

This frosting is a labor of love but well worth it! I made it for my husbands birthday. It took almost 30 minutes to thicken up, but it finally did. I made exactly as the recipe was written and cooked it at medium. It was just enough to frost the outside of a two layer 9 inch round cake, luckily I had another frosting I intended on using for the filling. Everyone loved it!

This came out fabulous on my first try.I toasted the pecans and coconut as the other reviews suggested.Also,have patience and stir constantly.The mixture will thicken in about 20-30min but stir,stir,stir. I will never but store bought icing again.

I really wish someone would define "until thick" for this recipe. I made it exactly as directed and declared it thick enough when it coated the spoon, as another reviewer suggested. I let it cool down to room temperature before frosting. It has been a couple of hours since then and it hasn't started to "set". I suspect I did not let it cook long enough. Good flavor though.
It's easier to make in a double boiler. The egg yolks are more forgiving

This is a great recipe!!
The caramel is so creamy and sticks to the sides of a double layer, round cake. 
I used the one bowl chocolate cake recipe. 
Amazing!! Thank you for the best recipes, Allrecipes
I love this recipe
I've loved this frosting since I was a child!

For those who are high altitudes please adjust this recipe. I will attempt this recipe again after I clean my oven. I baked this in the listed size pan and it doubled in size spilling all over inside my oven. It smells good.anyways. And I will update my rating then.
Delicious! I was a little nervous how it would turn out, as I only had nonfat evaporated milk. But it still set up just fine, and was appreciated by all who enjoyed it!
Love this kind of frosting! The changes I made was to double the recipe because I like a lot of frosting and I substituted heavy cream instead of the evaporated milk. It makes it SO much better!!!

Only thing different is I toasted the nuts and coconut and used 12 oz of evaporated milk. Love this recipe on a 12x9. I’ll take into consideration other reviews for increasing for layers. Also made this with a Duncan Hines mix so it paired really nice

I made the recipe as stated. I would not change a thing. I appreciated the r3views that reminded me that it may take a while to thicken up. I used medium heat and used the stirring time to dream about how good this frosting would taste. It received rave reviews, it was worth the effort and I will definitely make it again.
Had to make spme modifications: almonds instead of pecans, whole milk instead of evaporated, and powdered ginger instead of vanilla. Tastes great!
I always make this for Family and friends. This frosting is the bomb!

This frosting got rave reviews but I did follow the suggestions of Chey1 and used 1/2 white and 1/2 brown sugar and upped the coconut to 2 cups and the pecans to 1.5 cups. I generously frosted 2 dozen cupcakes and it was delicious!!

This is a great recipe for Coconut/Pecan icing for German chocolate cake. Followed the directions as written, except took a hint from other reviewers and cooked on medium heat. Mine took about thirteen minutes. Someone mentioned the lack of specificity in the directions, that is a title true, but I have been baking for over 60 years so it was not a problem. I would say one thing to look for is the mixture starts to change color, then it is near done. Also remember you are adding a lot of pecans and coconut. Taste is totally wonderful
It tastes really good, but I could not get the icing to thicken up.

Not as thick and Carmelly like would like. I’ll try to double brown sugar, increase egg yolk and will just have to place with it. Right now Sauce runs thru cake and leaves coconut and pecans on top of cake.
Delicious. We love this recipe.
Do not change a thing. This is so good, we were eating it from the bowl before we frosted the cake. Made this for my hubby’s great Aunt for her 94th birthday - , she loved it.
I cooked for 20 mins on medium heat . It was perfect
This recipe was awesome and easy to make. It's all in the frosting sometimes.
Even though I accidentally left out the butter, and left it to sit for 5 hours before frosting the cake, and the frosting was cold, and the cake was still a bit warm, it all worked and tasted great!

I made this cake and it was great, My mom used to make this cake, and it was nice to have that taste again. I didn't use wax paper on my Pans and the oil and flour seemed to weigh it down a little and it still came out great. Thank you

I followed the recipe using the 12 ounces of evaporated milk and adjusted the other ingredients--basically making one and a half recipe. I cooked it over medium heat for 17 minutes on my gas stove stirring constantly with a whisk. I will use this recipe again. Tastes sooooo good!

I'm so bummed! I read everyone's comments and cooked on medium for about 20 minutes until it thickened, added the pecans & coconut and set it aside to cool. When I went back to frost my cake it was hard & clumpy. It looked so good when it was cooking too :(
Very good. Much better than can frosting!
It turned out perfect

I decreased the brown sugar to 1/4 C and it was plenty sweet. My opinion is that we use entirely too much sugar which masks the flavor of the foods it sweetens. I only frosted in between the 2 layers and the top (see photo) so if you frost the sides you will need to make more frosting. It looked like it wasn't going to thicken so I put it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes which did the job.

I tweaked the recipe just a bit. Like some others mentioned I toasted the coconut and the nuts ( didn’t have enough pecans so I supplemented with almonds). I also added 1/2 tsp of salt and 1/2 tsp butter flavoring.

Okay so I made this. I read some reviews. Some said it takes 30+ minutes to thicken up. I don't know about you, but when I add milk, sugar and egg together and heat, it's like a pudding... I've messed up enough puddings and custards to know that cooking it for 30 minutes will result it something terrible. I think I spent about 15 minutes in the kitchen putting the cake in the oven, making this frosting and a chocolate butter cream frosting (for those who won't eat coconut or nuts). I had to run kids and my husband could handle taking the cake out. And my frosting was super thick and yummy! It was even thick enough I could really pile it on to be thicker than the butter cream side. Something that rarely happens with other recipes. It's just that good you guys!!! I will never use another recipe.

I cooked the sauce on medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring the entire time. It didn’t start to really thicken until around 16 minutes. I used dark brown sugar and it made the sauce seem a little grainy but once you add the pecans and coconut, it’s not noticeable. Very yummy!!
Not everyone even got to get a piece because it went too fast.
I toasted the coconut and pecans before adding them to the frosting , keeps the coconut from being to fibrous. this was very similar to my mothers recipe!
Easy to follow and it worked well.

This was a good frosting, a little too runny but I may have not let it cook down enough. I toasted my coconut beforehand and added it after the mixture cooled so it wasn’t super soggy and got a ton of compliments!
Made this multiple times now, every time it turns out delicious. Cook it slow!

Two things. Current amounts will NOT satisfy needs for a cake with two round layers. I suggest doubling or tripling. Also, highly suggest melting butter first then adding additional ingredients. Otherwise, you may end up with weird buttery clumps that don’t breakdown.
sooo amazingly good!

This recipe was simple enough that I was able to do it right on my first try, making my mother's day cake perfect. The frosting is so much better than the canned stuff. I'll be using this recipe again for sure.
